page.title: 07CHELMONDISTON C.OF E. CHURCH
page.content: St. Andrew's Church was originally built of flint. The Church and school were destroyed by a doodle-bug in 1943. The church was rebuilt in a similar style, but rendered in concrete. The school re-opened elsewhere in the village in 1973. In the Church, there are stained-glass windows and a sermon- glass. A new organ was installed in 1982. The bell is housed in the tower which now needs repairing. The Rector is shared with other Churches. On Wednesdays after school, children from Chelmondiston and Harkstead meet with the Rector for Children's Church. We draw and paint and do a variety of other things. At the moment our project is photography. We photograph each other and develop the films in a dark room. It is good fun and we look forward to it every week.
